rows.text: "Episode 378" "Sequence of Events: Part 1"
4 January 2006

Meadows' world starts to fall apart when a dying convict accuses him of a frame-up more than twenty years ago, and Manson is brought in to investigate his old boss. To make matters worse, suspicion falls on his drug-addicted son Benjamin for a series of robberies which Nixon and Webb are investigating, and wife Laura blames him for getting the wayward lad locked up. As the evidence stacks up against him, Meadows finds there's nowhere to turn.

"Episode 379" "Sequence of Events: Part 2"
5 January 2006

DPS officer Frank Keane warns Nixon and Webb away from helping Meadows, but when old colleague Manson catches up with the runaway copper and his former DI, Dougie Price, he allows him a further twenty-four hours in which to clear his name. Events take a sinister turn when Vince Parker is found dead, and it is left to Nixon and Webb to spot the links between Meadows' case and the beating of his son Benjamin in prison.

"Episode 380" "First Day Impressions"
Lewis Hardy
11 January 2006

New recruit Lewis Hardy gets off to a bad start with an official complaint lodged against him for an overzealous arrest, while fellow newcomer Emma Keane makes her presence felt with more aplomb. A man brought in for erratic driving surprises Stamp and Hemmingway by confessing he raped a woman the night before, but when the missing victim is traced it is far from clear which of them is the guilty party.

"Episode 381" "A Problem Multiplied"
Lucy Speed
12 January 2006

A young mother complains about the drug problem on her estate after she is threatened with a used needle, prompting Okaro to mount a raid which gives Hardy a chance to sample undercover work. Perkins and De Costa investigate a firearms incident at a local community centre, but they end up confronting a jilted lover desperate to find his ex. Casper fails to lure Keane with the offer of a spare room, and reluctantly lets Fletcher move in.

"Episode 382" "Street Level Action"
18 January 2006

De Costa develops a taste for street-level action when she helps Hunter and Perkins trace a machine gun-wielding shop raider, and is hailed a heroine after she wraps up the case in a dramatic showdown. Smithy's infatuation with gangster's wife Louise Larson leads to an agreement they will emigrate to Australia once she has testified against husband Pete and qualified for witness protection.

"Episode 383" "A Satisfying Day's Work"
19 January 2006

Smithy puts in a satisfying day's work as uniform branch arrest a property landlord found growing a secret crop of cannabis. But the besotted sergeant's romantic dreams are shattered when he sets out to meet Louise for the evening, only to be met by a gun-man. Hunter is speechless when Cindy turns up at the station with a toddler in tow and announces her plans to give up IVF treatment and adopt instead. Hemmingway and Stamp are called out to a hit and run, only to discover that Louise Larson has been killed, and that Smithy is at the wheel of the car.

"Episode 384" "Framed: Part 1"
Julian Tavell
25 January 2006

Smithy wakes up to a living nightmare as he is charged with drink-driving and interrogated on suspicion of deliberately killing Louise. The Sun Hill relief rally round their colleague and hopes are raised when a witness to the accident is found. Valentine sounds off to Keane about the DPS, only to discover that she is Frank's daughter, and JT shocks his friends and colleagues by announcing he's going to live in Spain.

"Episode 385" "Framed: Part 2"
26 January 2006

Smithy puts on a brave face for his court appearance but Meadows and CID's efforts to link Larson with Louise's death are derailed when their one lead - a gang member held on drugs charges - slips through the net. De Costa loses her appetite for community safety work after successfully investigating the case of a girl injured in an Angolan ritual exorcism with Sim, and Perkins' romantic hopes receive a setback.

"Episode 386" "Breaking Points"
1 February 2006

Perkins' romantic ambitions get a boost when De Costa ends her relationship with Saul, but she's busy impressing DCI Caddick of the Child Abuse Investigation Team with her ability to build links with the immigrant community. Together they discover a missing girl is a victim of trafficking. Meanwhile, Cindy Hunter's desperate desire to adopt a child pushes her marriage with Hunter to breaking point.

"Episode 387" "Personal Crusade"
2 February 2006

Nadir mounts a personal crusade to get Smithy off the hook and prove he was framed by Pete Larson, but DCI Keane of the DPS takes exception to his maverick methods and throws him off the case at a crucial moment after he and Webb arrest the suspect for handling stolen goods. De Costa and Perkins investigate a claim of child abuse twenty years after the event, and their sensitive handling of a tough investigation earns Ramani a job offer from DCI Caddick.

"Episode 388" "Operation: Trident: Part 1"
8 February 2006

Hardy witnesses a shooting at his cousin's engagement party and the Sun Hill relief take urgent action to stop the incident escalating into a gang war. The rookie copper is left feeling torn between family loyalties and enthusiasm for his new career. DS Shand arrives from Operation Trident to manage the investigation. Manson and Webb pressurise a local youth into supplying information on the shooting. Masters is contacted by a former informant for information about a business associate in Nottingham. Manson's wife Philippa shocks with the revelation that she is going to work in Spain.

"Episode 389" "Operation: Trident: Part 2"
Jo Masters
9 February 2006

Tough tactics and a high-risk operation pay off when the rival gang leaders are arrested on their way to a showdown. Having helped forestall a major outbreak of violence, Hardy feels alienated from his own community and decides to throw in his lot with the police, despite a suspicion of racism among his colleagues. Kapoor, Harman and Keane question a timid husband whose cheating wife has disappeared. Masters uncovers an illegal arms trading operation in Nottingham - and decides to leave Sun Hill to follow it up.

"Episode 390" "Missing: Part 1"
Mia Perry
15 February 2006

Nixon bails out Manson, and organises the CID end of an operation to trace a missing seven-year-old girl, while Hemmingway organises the uniform operation. The frantic parents agree to hold a press conference appealing for witnesses, but when it becomes clear all the known local paedophiles have alibis, inconsistencies in the father's account of events start to look suspicious. Hunter faces up to the fact his marriage is over. Meanwhile, Sun Hill is assigned its own station press officer, Mia Perry.

Hunter faces up to the fact his marriage is over. Meanwhile, Sun Hill is assigned its own station press officer, Mia Perry.

"Episode 393" "There Goes Another One"
Ramani DeCosta
1 March 2006

Nadir's off-the-record deal with gang member Jordan Tomlin backfires when a CID sting delivers only two of the promised eight automatic weapons. "Episode 395" "Maverick Approach"
8 March 2006

Nadir's maverick approach to the gangland gun trafficking blows up into a full-scale crisis when his informant, Jordan Tomlin, is shot during a DJ contest. Hardy resolves to have nothing more to do with cousin Dominic when he learns of his involvement in the crime, and is forced to decide between his loyalty to his family or the job, while Okaro has a public relations nightmare to sort out when the victim's mother criticises the police's handling of the case.

"Episode 396" "Confused Explanations: Part 1"
Bill Treacher
9 March 2006

Smithy upsets the Longmarsh heavies by spurning their offer of protection and is beaten up for his pains, but it is the approach of Louise's funeral that drives him to despair. Casper enters a supposedly empty flat where he is surprised to find a naked woman, and her confused explanation of how she came to be there finally gives the Sun Hill detectives a lead in the Pete Larson case. Meadows, Hunter, Webb and Nadir try to unravel a series of property deals involving Pete Larson and Joel Gates and prove a connection with Carl Caplan, who claims to have seen Smithy kill Louise Larson.

Sergeant Smith is Released from Prison
15 March 2006

Smithy is distraught when he's refused permission to attend Louise's funeral and loses control when he finds fellow prisoner Marty Johnson setting fire to a photograph of her. "Episode 398" "A Bad Call: Part 1"
16 March 2006

Feelings are running high following the death of Jordan Tomlin, and Okaro drafts in a full team to police a sell-out gig at the Bombastic nightclub. Forged tickets swell the crowd to dangerous levels and the punters turn nasty when Keane is forced to arrest a man for possession of drugs. Faced with a potential riot outside, Hemmingway makes a bad call which leads to disaster. Hardy's frustration of Valentine ends with disastrous consequences.

"Episode 399" "A Bad Call: Part 2"
Eddie Nestor
22 March 2006

The aftermath of the nightclub disaster leaves the Sun Hill relief in shock, and Okaro summons all the self-control he can muster to set aside personal tragedy before meeting Met Press Officer Mia Perry. Fletcher and Stamp face a traumatic morning trying to identify the bodies in a temporary morgue, and Keane reunites a mother with her dying son. At St. Hugh's, Hardy visits Valentine with the premise of an apology. Webb and Nixon investigate a case of stolen identity, but he is concentration is affected after becoming smitten with Mia Perry. Gold accompanies Okaro to his family's graves.

30 March 2006

Smithy gets a warm welcome when he reports for duty at Sun Hill, but is taken aback to discover he's assigned to investigate his former cellmate Morris Leatherhead over an allegation of theft. Valentine tries to cover up his difficulties while he and Kapoor search in vain for a cab driver who reportedly witnessed an assault - but evidence of his traumatised state begins to emerge, forcing Gold to make a ruling on whether he's fit to return to duty. "Episode 411" "Neglect of Duty"

Fletcher and Casper refer a case of bare-knuckle fighting to Sim and Nadir, who connect it to a GBH case they are already working on. Keane and Hardy interview a man in connection with a case of criminal damage, but he confesses to murdering his wife fourteen years earlier. Okaro wants Valentine referred to the DPS over his neglect of duty. Valentine's outbursts on duty lead Gold to insist he sees a psychiatrist. Gold presses Fletcher and Casper into entering an inter-services boxing competition. Keane feels awkward when her boyfriend joins the relief for drinks after work.

The future of Sun Hill station is under threat, and Heaton demands improved performance from the team. Valentine and Hollis come across the decomposed body of a drug user. Wright transfers across from Barton Street, and she later attends the scene of a failed robbery at a jeweller's shop with Stamp. Perkins questions a man about another planned robbery. Ackland and Rod Jessop discuss an anti-bullying campaign, and he proposes to her.
